content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Iron Smelting Furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0)
Consists of a furnace used to smelt iron ore with coal into iron plates (as seen in the smelting update at Step 1821).

### Copper Smelting Furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0)
Consists of a furnace used to smelt copper ore with coal into copper plates (as processed during copper plate production in Step 1822).

Note: Multiple attempts were made to locate, craft, and place a Lab at Position(x=0.5, y=2.5), but no Lab was successfully added to the map.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Usage with get_entities:
  - When calling get_entities, ensure you follow its defined signature. Avoid using unexpected keyword arguments (e.g. “radius”) or supplying extra positional arguments.
  - Validate the return value before iterating over it to prevent errors with NoneType objects.

• Lab Placement and Crafting:
  - Prior to attempting to place a Lab, verify that a Lab exists in the inventory.
  - For Lab crafting, double-check that all required sub-ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables) are available. Strengthen your resource processing (including smelting) to meet these prerequisites.

• Resource Dependency Management:
  - Ensure that cascading resource requirements are satisfied before initiating complex crafting recipes. Missing intermediate items (e.g. insufficient iron-plates or copper-plates to produce sub-ingredients) can lead to repeated crafting failures.
